etymology.description: Pictogram: leaves and branches above with roots below; alternatively a person’s hair above and feet below, indicating extremities.
etymology.interpretation: Imagery of the top and bottom ends conveys the notion of extremities, which extended metaphorically to ideas of being proper, upright, and focused. It also served as a phonetic element in later formations like 端 (duān).

examples.chinese: 他做事很耑(他做事很耑)。
examples.english: He is very focused in his work.

examples.chinese: 她举止很耑(她舉止很耑)。
老师希望我们态度耑，认真学习(老師希望我們態度耑，認真學習)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī xīwàng wǒmen tàidù duān, rènzhēn xuéxí.
examples.english: The teacher hopes we keep a proper attitude and study diligently.
